result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) and OWI (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Cameron C Lewis was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall be eligible for the Substance Abuse Program only after serving 2.5 years of initial confinement, including any credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Bond shall be applied towards the financial obligatons.  Any remaining bond shall be returned to whomever posted.  If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or full time school, or a combination of the two equal to full time status.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription. 

Defendant shall not enter any establishments where the primary purpose of business is the sale or service of alcohol.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall be eligible for the Substance Abuse Program only after serving 2.5 years of initial confinement, including any credit.

Sentencing hearing on August 9, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Def in person & by Atty Robert Charles Raymond.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  JURY TRIAL DAY 2.  Case called 8:27am w/out jury being present.  Court questions State and counsel.  Atty Raymond does not plan on calling any witnesses.  Jury present at 8:33am.  WITNESS:  Officer J. Chihak (recalled).  State rests.  Jury excused.  Counsel argues motion re blood draw on the record; State replies.  Court denies motion.  Def will not testify.  Court questions def and finds def freely and voluntarily exercises his right to remain silent.  Jury present.  Defense rests.  Jury excused.  Recess.  Reconvene w/out jury.  Discussion re jury instructions and verdict forms.  Jury present.  Closing arguments.  Court reads jury instructions.  Jury excused for deliberations at 10:42am.  Recess.  Reconvene w/jury present.  Court reads verdict - jury finds def guilty.  Jury polled.  Court thanks jury and releases them at 11:21am.  State moves for judgment on the verdict; Court grants motion and revokes def's bond.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Emails with attached Subpoena Duces Tecum and letter from Atty Raymond

Def in person & by Atty Robert Charles Raymond.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  JURY TRIAL DAY 1.  Case called 8:18am w/out jury.  State moves to dismiss Ct 1; Court so orders.  Atty Raymond requests to reschedule; Court denies request.  Discussion re proceeding on Ct 2 only.  Court directs comments re voir dire to State and counsel.  State req Court quash requirement that expert bring reference material as stated in subpoena from defense counsel;  Court grants request.  Recess.  Reconvene w/jury present at 9:13am.  Jury panel sworn.  20 jurors called to box.  Voir dire by Court.  Voir dire by counsel.  One juror replaced by Court.  Jurors struck.  12 juror names called.  Remaining jurors thanked and released at 10:33am.  Court directs comments to jurors.  Jurors sworn after voir dire.  Jurors excused.  Discussion re exhibits.  Counsel moves for sequestration of witnesses; Court so orders.  Discussion re prior OWI convictions.  Def acknowledges prior OWI convictions.  Recess.  Reconvene w/jury present.  Court gives preliminary instructions to jury.  No note taking allowed.  Opening statements.  WITNESSES:  Kelly D.  State plays video.  Jury admonished and excused for lunch.  Recess.  Reconvene w/out jury present.  Comments from court re "blanking" CCAP as requested by counsel.  Jury now present.  WITNESSES:  Danielle M.; Officer J. Chihak (WBPD).  Jury excused.  Argument from State re statements/heresay.  Discussion re one officer not being present.  Recess.  Reconvene w/jury present.  Court directs comments to jury re one officer not being present.  WITNESS:  Kimberle G. (State Lab of Hygiene). Jury admonished and excused for the evening at 4:51pm.

Jury trial on May 1, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Robert Charles Raymond.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.   Motions in limine.  Atty Raymond believes 3 days may be needed for jury trial (2 have been set aside).  Court questions State and counsel re witnesses.  State objects to some of def's witnesses.  Discussion re rescheduling trial to be 3 days.  Recess.  Reconvene.  Court reschedules trial to be 3 days beginning on May 1, 2017 (this is the only trial set for 5-1 and will proceed).  Argument from State and counsel re motions in limine.  Court rules on motions in limine on the record.  State and counsel to advise Court and each other as to what portion of any video will be played by 3-1-17.  Court orders State and counsel to disclose who will testify with a summary of what they will testify to and dates of birth; simultaneous exchange of information to be done by 3-1-17.  State/counsel to also exchange resumes of any expert witnesses that will be called & what version of student field sobriety training manual any witness who will testify to this is relying on by 3-1-17.  Court makes further rulings on motions in limine on the record.  State/counsel shall submit letter or order re their respective motions in limine; shall exchange w/one another and submit to Court.  Court makes further rulings on State's motions in limine.  If anything was not addressed, State/counsel shall advise.  State to submit letter setting forth schedule for simultaneous exchange of information.  Jury trial scheduled for May 1, 2017 at 08:15 am.
